intro: Rosa ciliatosepala, commonly known as the fringed-sepaled rose, is a species of flowering plant in the rose family. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern China and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, featuring compound leaves with serrated edges. Its sepals are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it the species name "ciliatosepala." The flowers are usually pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer.
